title: United Kingdom ( UK ) property market 2013 - 2016 , by submarket value
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Submarkets on X-axis for 4 groups 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Submarket value in billion GBP.

For Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing, 2016 had the highest Submarket value in billion GBP 4805.0 among the 4 groups and in Infrastructure, 2013 had the lowest Submarket value in billion GBP 0.0.

Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing and Other non-domestic buildings had the biggest gap of 4297.0 between the highest and lowest Submarket value in billion GBP found for 2015.

Averaging all 4 groups 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016, the Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing is the maximum Submarket value in billion GBP and Other non-domestic buildings is the minimum Submarket value in billion GBP.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Submarket value in billion GBP on the Y-axis for 5 different Submarkets for 4 groups 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016 that are presented on the X-axis.

Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing had the maximum Submarket value in billion GBP among all 4 groups, and it was for 2016. The minimum Submarket value in billion GBP was observed in Submarket Infrastructure for 2013.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Submarkets on X-axis for 4 groups 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Submarket value in billion GBP.

For Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing, 2016 had the highest Submarket value in billion GBP 4805.0 among the 4 groups and in Infrastructure, 2013 had the lowest Submarket value in billion GBP 0.0.

Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing and Other non-domestic buildings had the biggest gap of 4297.0 between the highest and lowest Submarket value in billion GBP found for 2015.

Averaging all 4 groups 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016, the Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing is the maximum Submarket value in billion GBP and Other non-domestic buildings is the minimum Submarket value in billion GBP.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Submarkets on X-axis for 4 groups 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Submarket value in billion GBP.

Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing had the maximum Submarket value in billion GBP among all 4 groups, and it was for 2016. The minimum Submarket value in billion GBP was observed in Submarket Infrastructure for 2013.

For Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing, 2015 had the maximum Submarket value in billion GBP and it saw the lowest in Submarket Other non-domestic buildings out of all 5 Submarkets.

The maximum Submarket value in billion GBP for 2015 that was found in Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing was 27.36 times larger than the minimum Submarket value in billion GBP observed in Submarket Other non-domestic buildings.
Out of all 4 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Submarket value in billion GBP was found in case of 2015.

2016 had the maximum Submarket value in billion GBP out of all 4 groups in Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing followed by 2016 in Residential property: owner occupied & social housing, and the minimum Submarket value in billion GBP is found for 2013 in Infrastructure.

Averaging all 4 groups 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016, the Submarket Residential property: owner occupied & social housing is the maximum Submarket value in billion GBP and Other non-domestic buildings is the minimum Submarket value in billion GBP.

data.Submarket: Residential property: owner occupied & social housing
